section.heading: Registration; display of registration sticker, license, and warning sign; locations of game of skill machines.

para.text: A retailer shall register each of its game of skill machines in the District with the Office before the game of skill machine may be installed at the licensed establishment.
A retailer shall locate its game of skill machines for play only in specific locations approved by ABRA within the retailer's licensed establishment.

A retailer shall affix and maintain a registration sticker issued by the Office to the game of skill machine at all times the game of skill machine is located at the establishment. If the registration sticker is damaged, destroyed, lost, or removed, the retailer shall pay the Office $75 for a replacement registration sticker.

A retailer shall post both its retailer's license and a warning sign, maintained in good repair and in a place clearly visible at the point of entry to the designated areas where the game of skill machines are located. The warning sign shall include:
The minimum age required to play a game of skill machine;
The contact information for the District's gambling hotline; and
The contact information for the Office for purposes of filing a complaint against the manufacturer, supplier, distributor, or retailer.

Failure to display the registration sticker, license, or warning sign may result in the Office revoking or suspending the license or issuing a fine against the licensed establishment pursuant to section 416.
